alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Bayfield; Douglas; Iron; Sawyer (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 17 at 6:05PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN ITASCA...NORTHEASTERN AITKIN...NORTHEASTERN PINE...SOUTHWESTERN ST. LOUIS...CARLTON... SOUTHERN BAYFIELD...DOUGLAS...WESTERN IRON...ASHLAND AND NORTHWESTERN SAWYER COUNTIES... At 603 PM CDT, a snow squall is being observed by radar along a line extending from near Swan River, to Duluth, to near Gile, and moving south at 15 mph. Heavy snow with visibilities less than a quarter of a mile are expected under this band. This squall will be near... South Range around 610 PM CDT. Hawthorne and Jacobson around 615 PM CDT. Big Sandy Lake and Libby around 700 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this squall include Gary New Duluth, Gile Flowage, Moose Junction, Amnicon Lake, Pence, Jay Cooke State Park, Norton Park, Esko, Harlis and High Bridge. Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter of a mile in this squall. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this dangerous snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location.
